ggplot_save_function

Source: R/auxiliary_visuals.R
ggplot_save_function.Rd

Function to automatically save plots to directory of interest

ggplot_save_function(
  gobject,
  plot_object,
  save_dir = NULL,
  save_folder = NULL,
  save_name = NULL,
  default_save_name = "giotto_plot",
  save_format = NULL,
  show_saved_plot = F,
  ncol = 1,
  nrow = 1,
  scale = 1,
  base_width = NULL,
  base_height = NULL,
  base_aspect_ratio = NULL,
  units = NULL,
  dpi = NULL,
  limitsize = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

gobject

giotto object
plot_object

ggplot object to plot
save_dir

directory to save to
save_folder

folder in save_dir to save to
save_name

name of plot
save_format

format (e.g. png, tiff, pdf, ...)
show_saved_plot

load & display the saved plot
ncol

number of columns
nrow

number of rows
scale

scale
base_width

width
base_height

height
base_aspect_ratio

aspect ratio
units

units
dpi

Plot resolution
limitsize

When TRUE (the default), ggsave will not save images larger than 50x50 inches, to prevent the common error of specifying dimensions in pixels.

See also

cowplot::save_plot

Examples

    ggplot_save_function(gobject)

Contents

  • Arguments
  • See also
  • Examples
